title: Fundamentals of Practice
description: Rigorous treatment of practice theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Principles of Seminar
description: Rigorous treatment of seminar theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Applied Workshop
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in workshop. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Applied Applications
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in applications. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Theory
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in theory. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Theory
description: Interdisciplinary approach to theory combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Methods
description: Comprehensive study of methods with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Graduate Theory
description: Rigorous treatment of theory theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: ECON 322 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Seminar
description: Rigorous treatment of seminar theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: ECON 308 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Research
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of research. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: ECON 317 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Methods
description: In-depth analysis of methods principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: ECON 392 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Applications
description: Interdisciplinary approach to applications combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: ECON 376 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Methods
description: Rigorous treatment of methods theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: ECON 303 and senior standing or graduate status
